text: Bottle share at Canary Wharf, many thanks to Leighton. As Urban Chestnut BAP. Clear pale yellow, lightly sparkling, big foamy white head. Aroma is green apple, lager mustiness, a touch sour maybe. Body is light, tingly carbonation, foamy. Taste is apple, cracker malt, touch sweet, buttery, no real bitterness. An insipid sweet and simple beer with no punch. (2.4)

Bottle shared at level 42 Canary wharf tasting. 5/4/2016. Many thanks to Leighton for this one. Mostly clear golden yellow coloured pour with a lasting frothy white head. Aroma is decent fresh cereal grains, light esters, hints of citrus. Flavour is composed of tangy cereal grains. Hints of apple, pear. Solid. Palate is frothy. Semi crisp, highish. Decent kolsch.

5th April 201642nd Floor Tasting. Thanks to Mr Smith. Almost clear gold beer, tidy cream colour head. Palate is airy and dry with good fine carbonation. Clean pale malts, thin cream. Light German nuttyness in the malts. Mild and tangy citric hop. Lighty semi dry finish. Clean.

50cl bottle shared at the early April CW tasting, London. Many thanks to Leighton. It pours a clean yellow color with medium white head. Aroma is sweet and fruity with some apricots and lemon peel. Taste is also lightly sweet and tangy with light grass melon and citrus peel. Light to medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, ok

Bottle thanks to Leighton. It pours clear gold with a thick white head. The aroma is fresh, buttered white bread, straw and baked goods. The taste is crisp, bitter, buttered white bread, mild astringency, baked goods, apple and straw with a dry finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Alright.

Bottl shared in London - sourced from the US. Pours perfectly clear yellow with a tight, creamy white head. The nose holds doughy biscuits, cereal, hay. Light sweet flavor with some lemon peel, light bitter pale grain husk, more biscuits, straw. Light bodied with average carbonation. Lightly drying on the finish, some bitter grass and straw, hints of lemon peel. Solid overall.

Bottle at the level 42 tasting V1.5 05/04/16, thanks to LKS.
Light golden blonde with a well appointed off white covering.
Nose is bready malts, melon, tangerine, straw.
Taste comprises airy malts, grain, melon, bread dough, light spice, lemon drizzle.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close.
Decent enough for style.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Pours a faintly hazy yellow with a white thin head. The nose is cereal. Palate is similar to a lager. Taste has a tartness with the light malt. There is bitter aftertaste. Half Liter Bottle

Pour is a clear yellow with a large fizzy white head. Aroma is a nice doughy cereal malt. Like fresh baked bread. Flavor is a fresh lager grainy malt with a nice grassy hop and a ever so slight touch of citrus tartness. This was a very nice kolsch. A much heavier body that others of the style but drinks incredibly clean. If this was the next beer to come out in 4 packs I would have to pick some up.
Pours a slightly hazy pale yellow with a big fluffy white head. Bread and slight hop aroma. Taste is sweet pale malt, bread dough, a bit of fruitiness and mild hop flowers.
Very cloudy, straw color. Thin white head. Yeasty. Very crisp. Lots of flavor.

On tap at Bridge Tap House in STL. Pours a hazy light yellow. Thin white head. Little aroma. Grassy lemony flavor. Nice and refreshing. Nice light bodied beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ Urban Chestnut. Pale golden pour with a white head. Grass, some chalk, and lemon peel. Lots of cracker and pale malts. Nice, dry palate. Tons of lemon, chalk, grass, and cracker. Good bread and pale malt. Light apple esters. Ok.
Yellow pour with creamy white and lace. Light malt on the nose. Light slightly sweet start with a flat bitter finish. Medium bodied and fizzy.

Draft @ Urban Chestnut Midtown Brewery & Biergarten, St Louis, MO. Pours a hazy pale yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity grainy aroma. Fruity malty grainy crisp flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy weak grassy finish.

Taster at the brewpub during RBSG. Mildly hazy yellow color. Pours with a great bigger white head, leaves good lace, retains well. Good bready malt, light peppery. Light to medium body. Smooth, lighter, kind of creamy carbonation. Light dry finish. Moderate sweet taste, lightly spicy. Awesome kolsch.
Sampled at Urban Chestnut during RBSG. Pours a cloudy golden color with white head. Grainy, earthy, hay aromas. Bitter, grainy, straw flavors.

4 oz draft pour at Urban Chestnut Midtown during RBSG 2014. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of light skunk, citrus, floral. Tastes of citrus, floral, light pine, wheat. Medium body with a dry finish.

Draft flight on tap at the brewpub (St. Louis, MO). Pours a straw pale yellow hue, decent haziness in the body with nice frothy whitish head that stays as a nice film, laces ok as it rings. Aromas are a bit fruity, gentle bread and touches of straw. A touch of butter and odd sulfur note. Initial shows gentle fruit, touches of bread and crisp apple fruit, a bit fleshy. Backend is a bit yeasty, dry. Nicer lighter body with just a touch of oomph. Bready malts, grainy and cereal with just a faint toasting. This comes together as I get further in, the nose seemed a bit off but the beer itself develops well.
Draft. A clean but ultiamtely non descript koelsch which isnt necesarily a bad thig.

This is cloudy blond with a fine bubbled head that has great retention It has slight lemon and herbal notes in the nose. It is very slightly tart with a nice, crisp taste. The carbonation is quite heavy and this is light bodied and refreshing. This is definitely a tasty brew thats great for the hot St. Louis summers.
Draft. Nose is lightly minerally with some sulfur or something. Taste is clean with a light breadiness to it. Ok.

Sampled from the tap at the brewpub. Pours a clear light gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a nice earthy grain and straw with a hint of a bread. Flavor is very crisp with straw and grains, very smooth.

Tasted at St. Louis Brewers Guild Heritage Fest 2014 in a cool nonic sampler glass. It poured a nice clear straw colour with massive fluffy white foam and beautiful lace. Crisp grainy Germanic malt, flowery and peppery noble hops, mildly fruity ale yeast esters, exactly everything a Kolsch should be. One of the best Ive ever had. Well-crafted, wonderful.
It poured a pale golden color with a white head. The aroma was of citrus, malt and some spicy hops. The taste was similar with a light body, citrus notes and a nice hop bitterness.

Sampled at Heritage Fest. Golden with a white head. Fairly complex. Honey is ligjt. Well, every flavor is light. Noble hobs with some fruit and a bit of sulfur. Soft fruit. Nice malts. Just a nicely done beer and far from in your face.

Tap at brewpub june 2012-pours lite hazy orange with a soapy white head around the rim of the glass (as usual)  Some rocky layers to the head-kind of different looking.  nose is lite spice, good amount of sulfer and spicy hops lite pale malt grain but not overly husky,  flavors of lite spice dry grain cereal notes with a very nice body (crisp and lite).  a very good version of a Kolsch albeit a bit different.  Wish i could have some more of this one.

Clean and easy to drink. Nice hop bitterness that is crisp, but doesn't linger - which means you want another. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(tap at bewpub) slightly hazy pale straw with small white head. Aroma of light malt and a hint of citrus. Flavor is light malt and grassy hops with a hint of lemon. Served in a proper Stange - bonus for that.

Draft at the brewpub, enjoyed on the new beer garden. Pours a cloudy, pale straw yellow color with a finger of bone white head that setlles into a thin, lasting head. Aroma of straw, wheat, grassy hops, dry bread and grains, and sawdust. The flavor is a more bready, less grassy version of the same. Light-bodied, with a dry, grainy mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Good Kolsch with a definite UCBC character to it.

Pours hazy orange / yellow with a white head.  The aroma has husky pale malt, some bread, light hops, hint of spice and sulfur - aroma is very full.  Medium body that is fuller than normal for the style, but that may be due to being very unfiltered.  It has soft carbonation.  The flavor starts with pale malt, cereal, spice, grass and light dough.  The finish has nice crisp lively hoppiness and full malt.  Excellent take on a kolsch.
